content.rendered:
Sustainability

Initiatives

Our Sustainability Journey

The Guardsman Hotel is committed to proactively work to become more sustainable. With this in mind, we have partnered with mission : net zero and signed up to the Green Tourism certification program to help us on our sustainability journey. The internationally respected accreditation programme of Bronze, Silver and Gold awards are acknowledged worldwide as an indicator of good environmentally-friendly practice and are a great way of progressing on a green journey as well as acting as a hallmark of 'green quality' for our eco minded visitors. We want to act responsibly and for sustainability to become second nature in our day to day operation. Becoming a member of Green Tourism is a brilliant first step to getting greener by focussing on: reducing energy use, saving water, efficient & eco-friendly waste disposal, supporting environmentally focused community projects, promoting team wellbeing & mental health, helping conserve local cultural heritage, ethical buying, staying local & seasonal, promoting biodiversity and more. For more details on the Green Tourism Award, please visit https://www.green-tourism.com/

Read our Guardsman-Sustainability-Policy-June-2024

Please ask a member of the team if you have any questions or feedback on the hotels ‘green journey’ and to find out all about how you can get involved.

Stay up to date on our 'Green Journey' by following us on our social media channels:
Instagram - Facebook -  LinkedIn 

 

LOW CARBON ACTIVITIES

Bike Share

London is lovely to explore by bike. There are several Santander docking stations near the hotel for hire.

View Bike Stations Map

Low Carbon Activities

Public Transportation

Explore London by hopping on a classic double-decker bus. Sit on the top deck for an iconic experience, enjoying the city's famous landmarks and views.

Nearby Bus Routes: 148, 11, 26, 24

Ride the Tube to experience all London has to offer. Take advantage of the extensive network and don't forget to mind the gap!

St James’s Park Station: Circle and District Lines
Victoria Station: Circle, District and Victoria Lines;
National Rail from Victoria: Southern, Southeastern, Gatwick Express

Plan a Journey

LOW CARBON ACTIVITIES

Electric Vehicles

Did you know it's possible to call for an electric taxi? When booking via your ridesharing app opt for an electric black cab for a more sustainable journey.

There are also several electric vehicle charging points in the area to use.

View Charging Points Map

serpData.description: The Guardsman's journey to sustainability through Green Tourism initiatives, focusing on energy reduction, water conservation, waste disposal, and community.
